titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the John Maudgridge Snowden Allison Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday January 10, 2019 at 08:06

did.unittitle: John Maudgridge Snowden Allison papers

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: Papers of John Maudgridge Snowden Allison, author and professor of history at Yale University. The papers contain correspondence, teaching materials, and research files, including original letters and documents by French political figures of the 18th and 19th century. Among these are François Guizot, Alphonse Larmartine, King Louis Philippe, Chrétien Malesherbes, and Adolphe Thiers. Also included is a promissory note by Talleyrand and documents signed by Louis XVI. Among his personal correspondents are Léon Allégret, Henri Focillon, Henri Malo, Richard L. Tighe, Chauncey Brewster Tinker, Gilbert M. Troxell, and Henri Peyre. Two-thirds of the papers are made up of teaching materials and include lectures and lecture notes, student papers, card files and essays, articles and reviews on French history. Also included are papers relating to Allison's army service during World War I and extensive correspondence with his mother from his school days through World War I.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: John Maudgridge Snowden Allison Papers (MS 33). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Author, educator; B.A., Princeton, 1910, M.A., 1912, Ph.D., 1914; instructor and assistant professor in history, Yale, 1914-1926, associate professor, European history, 1926-1929, professor of European history, 1929-1935, Randolph W. Townsend, Jr. Professor, 1935-1944; author of books on French history.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Papers of John Maudgridge Snowden Allison, author and professor of history at Yale University. The papers contain correspondence, teaching materials, and research files, including original letters and documents by French political figures of the 18th and 19th century. Among these are François Guizot, Alphonse Larmartine, King Louis Philippe, Chrétien Malesherbes, and Adolphe Thiers. Also included is a promissory note by Talleyrand and documents signed by Louis XVI. Among his personal correspondents are Léon Allégret, Henri Focillon, Henri Malo, Richard L. Tighe, Chauncey Brewster Tinker, Gilbert M. Troxell, and Henri Peyre. Two-thirds of the papers are made up of teaching materials and include lectures and lecture notes, student papers, card files and essays, articles and reviews on French history. Also included are papers relating to Allison's army service during World War I and extensive correspondence with his mother from his school days through World War I.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes two copies of a letter regarding the freedom of the press

did.unittitle: Copies of ten letters to and from Malesherbes or to his contemporaries
Signed letter to M. Thouin
Note in Malesherbe's hand, probably regarding revisions he wished made in some author's manuscript before he would authorize its printing
Epigraph, in Malesherbe's handwriting, for M. de Condamne
Signed, autographed letter from Malesherbes to M. de Forebonais
Signed, autographed letter from Malesherbes to unnamed correspondent
Typewritten copy of a memorandum by Malesherbes on the coming meeting of the Estates General
Manuscript copy of a discourse prepared by Malesherbes for St. Martin's Day, 1789 on the character of the French magistracy
Account of an uprising at Limoges, probably written for Malesherbes
Malesherbes' Observations on his exile and on M. Rene Nicholas de Maupeou
Manuscript copy of Malesherbes' discourse on the decline of discipline and dangers of unbridled independence among the magistrates
Letters from Malesherbes to unnamed correspndents
Letter to M. de Boisgibault
Letter to the Marechal de Noailles
Signed letter to M. de Louvois
Signed letter to unnamed correspondent, his nephew
Signed, autographed letter from M. Chouart to Malesherbes
Signed letter from Murine to M. Le Brun concerning property bought by Malesherbes
Signed, autographed letter from L. de Barbancais to unnamed correspondent, declining to subscribe to a subscription for a memorial to Malsherbes
Engravings of Malsherbes

odd.head: General note
odd.p: The dates of these letters are 1936 Jul 1, Dec 13; 1938 Mar 10, May 20; 1939 Feb 21, Apr 22, Sep 27; and 1940 Mar 2
